segment.source: Set up and turn on Enterprise Mode logging and data collection in your organization.
segment.target: Set up and turn on Enterprise Mode logging and data collection in your organization.

segment.source: Set up Enterprise Mode logging and data collection (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Set up Enterprise Mode logging and data collection (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Set up Enterprise Mode logging and data collection
segment.target: Set up Enterprise Mode logging and data collection

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)

segment.source: Using Group Policy, you can turn on Enterprise Mode for Internet Explorer and then you can turn on local user control using the Let users turn on and use Enterprise Mode from the Tools menu setting, located in the category path.
segment.target: Using Group Policy, you can turn on Enterprise Mode for Internet Explorer and then you can turn on local user control using the Let users turn on and use Enterprise Mode from the Tools menu setting, located in the category path.

segment.source: After you turn this setting on, your users can turn on Enterprise Mode locally, from the IE Tools menu.
segment.target: After you turn this setting on, your users can turn on Enterprise Mode locally, from the IE Tools menu.

segment.source: enterprise mode option on the tools menu
segment.target: enterprise mode option on the tools menu

segment.source: The Let users turn on and use Enterprise Mode from the Tools menu setting also lets you decide where to send the user reports (as a URL).
segment.target: The Let users turn on and use Enterprise Mode from the Tools menu setting also lets you decide where to send the user reports (as a URL).

segment.source: We recommend creating a custom HTTP port 81 to let your incoming user information go to a dedicated site.
segment.target: We recommend creating a custom HTTP port 81 to let your incoming user information go to a dedicated site.

segment.source: A dedicated site is important so you can quickly pick out the Enterprise Mode traffic from your other website traffic.
segment.target: A dedicated site is important so you can quickly pick out the Enterprise Mode traffic from your other website traffic.

segment.source: group policy to turn on enterprise mode
segment.target: group policy to turn on enterprise mode

segment.source: Getting these reports lets you find out about sites that aren’t working right, so you can add them to your Enterprise Mode site list, without having to locate them all yourself.
segment.target: Getting these reports lets you find out about sites that aren’t working right, so you can add them to your Enterprise Mode site list, without having to locate them all yourself.

segment.source: For more information about creating and using a site list, see the Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using a file and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2) or the Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using a file and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.1) topic, based on your operating system.
segment.target: For more information about creating and using a site list, see the Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using a file and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2) or the Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using a file and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.1) topic, based on your operating system.

segment.source: Using ASP to collect your data
segment.target: Using ASP to collect your data

segment.source: When you turn logging on, you need a valid URL that points to a server that can be listened to for updates to a user’s registry key.
segment.target: When you turn logging on, you need a valid URL that points to a server that can be listened to for updates to a user’s registry key.

segment.source: This means you need to set up an endpoint server for the incoming POST messages, which are sent every time the user turns Enterprise Mode on or off from the Tools menu.
segment.target: This means you need to set up an endpoint server for the incoming POST messages, which are sent every time the user turns Enterprise Mode on or off from the Tools menu.

segment.source: To set up an endpoint server
segment.target: To set up an endpoint server

segment.source: Configure an IIS server to work with your Enterprise Mode data collection process.
segment.target: Configure an IIS server to work with your Enterprise Mode data collection process.

segment.source: If you’re unsure how to set up IIS, see the IIS installation webpage.
segment.target: If you’re unsure how to set up IIS, see the IIS installation webpage.

segment.source: Open Internet Information Services (IIS) and turn on the ASP components from the Add Roles and Features Wizard, Server Roles page.
segment.target: Open Internet Information Services (IIS) and turn on the ASP components from the Add Roles and Features Wizard, Server Roles page.

segment.source: This lets you create an ASP form that accepts the incoming POST messages.
segment.target: This lets you create an ASP form that accepts the incoming POST messages.

segment.source: Open the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager, click Bindings, highlight Port 81, click Edit, and then change the website information to point to Port 81 so it matches your custom-created port.
segment.target: Open the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager, click Bindings, highlight Port 81, click Edit, and then change the website information to point to Port 81 so it matches your custom-created port.

segment.source: IIS Manager, editing website bindings
segment.target: IIS Manager, editing website bindings

segment.source: Open the Logging feature, pick W3C for the format, and click Select Fields to open the W3C Logging Fields box.
segment.target: Open the Logging feature, pick W3C for the format, and click Select Fields to open the W3C Logging Fields box.

segment.source: IIS Manager, setting logging options
segment.target: IIS Manager, setting logging options

segment.source: Change the WC3 logging fields to include only the Date, Client IP, User Name, and URI Query standard fields, and then click OK.
segment.target: Change the WC3 logging fields to include only the Date, Client IP, User Name, and URI Query standard fields, and then click OK.

segment.source: Using only these fields keeps the log file simple, giving you the date, client IP address, and the website URI information for any site changed by your users.
segment.target: Using only these fields keeps the log file simple, giving you the date, client IP address, and the website URI information for any site changed by your users.

segment.source: Apply these changes to your default website and close the IIS Manager.
segment.target: Apply these changes to your default website and close the IIS Manager.

segment.source: Put your EmIE.asp file into the root of the web server, using this command:
segment.target: Put your EmIE.asp file into the root of the web server, using this command:

segment.source: This code logs your POST fields to your IIS log file, where you can review all of the collected data.
segment.target: This code logs your POST fields to your IIS log file, where you can review all of the collected data.

segment.source: IIS log file information
segment.target: IIS log file information

segment.source: This is what your log files will look like after you set everything up and at least one of your users has turned on Enterprise Mode locally from the Tools menu.
segment.target: This is what your log files will look like after you set everything up and at least one of your users has turned on Enterprise Mode locally from the Tools menu.

segment.source: You can see the URL of the problematic website and client IP address of the user that turned on Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: You can see the URL of the problematic website and client IP address of the user that turned on Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: Enterprise Mode log file
segment.target: Enterprise Mode log file

segment.source: Using the GitHub sample to collect your data
segment.target: Using the GitHub sample to collect your data

segment.source: Microsoft has created the EMIE-Data-Collection_Sample that shows how to collect your Enterprise Mode reports.
segment.target: Microsoft has created the EMIE-Data-Collection_Sample that shows how to collect your Enterprise Mode reports.

segment.source: This sample only shows how to collect data, it doesn’t show how to aggregate the data into your Enterprise Mode site list.
segment.target: This sample only shows how to collect data, it doesn’t show how to aggregate the data into your Enterprise Mode site list.

segment.source: This sample starts with you turning on Enterprise Mode and logging (either through Group Policy, or by manually setting the EnterpriseMode registry key) so that your users can use Enterprise Mode locally.
segment.target: This sample starts with you turning on Enterprise Mode and logging (either through Group Policy, or by manually setting the EnterpriseMode registry key) so that your users can use Enterprise Mode locally.

segment.source: For the steps to do this, go to Turn on local control and logging for Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: For the steps to do this, go to Turn on local control and logging for Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you decide to manually change the registry key, you can change the Enable setting to , which automatically sends your reports to this page.
segment.target: If you decide to manually change the registry key, you can change the Enable setting to , which automatically sends your reports to this page.

segment.source: Setting up, collecting, and viewing reports
segment.target: Setting up, collecting, and viewing reports

segment.source: For logging, you’re going to need a valid URL that points to a server that can be listened to for updates to a user’s registry key.
segment.target: For logging, you’re going to need a valid URL that points to a server that can be listened to for updates to a user’s registry key.

segment.source: This means you need to set up an endpoint server for the incoming POST messages, which are sent every time the user turns Enterprise Mode on or off from the Tools menu.
segment.target: This means you need to set up an endpoint server for the incoming POST messages, which are sent every time the user turns Enterprise Mode on or off from the Tools menu.

segment.source: These POST messages go into your database, aggregating the report data by URL, giving you the total number of reports where users turned on Enterprise Mode, the total number of reports where users turned off Enterprise Mode, and the date of the last report.
segment.target: These POST messages go into your database, aggregating the report data by URL, giving you the total number of reports where users turned on Enterprise Mode, the total number of reports where users turned off Enterprise Mode, and the date of the last report.

segment.source: To set up the sample
segment.target: To set up the sample

segment.source: Set up a server to collect your Enterprise Mode information from your users.
segment.target: Set up a server to collect your Enterprise Mode information from your users.

segment.source: Go to the Internet Explorer/EMIE-Data_Collection_Sample page on GitHub and tap or click the Download ZIP button to download the complete project.
segment.target: Go to the Internet Explorer/EMIE-Data_Collection_Sample page on GitHub and tap or click the Download ZIP button to download the complete project.

segment.source: Open Microsoft Visual Studio 2013 with Update 2, and then open the PhoneHomeSample.sln file.
segment.target: Open Microsoft Visual Studio 2013 with Update 2, and then open the PhoneHomeSample.sln file.

segment.source: On the Build menu, tap or click Build Solution.
segment.target: On the Build menu, tap or click Build Solution.

segment.source: The required packages are automatically downloaded and included in the solution.
segment.target: The required packages are automatically downloaded and included in the solution.

segment.source: To set up your endpoint server
segment.target: To set up your endpoint server

segment.source: Right-click on the name, PhoneHomeSample, and click Publish.
segment.target: Right-click on the name, PhoneHomeSample, and click Publish.

segment.source: Visual Studio, Publish menu
segment.target: Visual Studio, Publish menu

segment.source: In the Publish Web wizard, pick the publishing target and options that work for your organization.
segment.target: In the Publish Web wizard, pick the publishing target and options that work for your organization.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Make sure you have a database associated with your publishing target.
segment.target: Make sure you have a database associated with your publishing target.

segment.source: Otherwise, your reports won’t be collected and you’ll have problems deploying the website.
segment.target: Otherwise, your reports won’t be collected and you’ll have problems deploying the website.

segment.source: Visual Studio, Publish Web wizard
segment.target: Visual Studio, Publish Web wizard

segment.source: After you finish the publishing process, you need to test to make sure the app deployed successfully.
segment.target: After you finish the publishing process, you need to test to make sure the app deployed successfully.

segment.source: To test, deploy, and use the app
segment.target: To test, deploy, and use the app

segment.source: Open a registry editor on the computer where you deployed the app, go to the key, and change the Enable string to:
segment.target: Open a registry editor on the computer where you deployed the app, go to the key, and change the Enable string to:

segment.source: Where points to your deployment URL.
segment.target: Where points to your deployment URL.

segment.source: After you’re sure your deployment works, you can deploy it to your users using one of the following:
segment.target: After you’re sure your deployment works, you can deploy it to your users using one of the following:

segment.source: Turn on the Let users turn on and use Enterprise Mode from the Tools menu Group Policy setting, putting your information into the Options box.
segment.target: Turn on the Let users turn on and use Enterprise Mode from the Tools menu Group Policy setting, putting your information into the Options box.

segment.source: Deploy the registry key in Step 3 using System Center or other management software.
segment.target: Deploy the registry key in Step 3 using System Center or other management software.

segment.source: Get your users to visit websites, turning Enterprise Mode on or off locally, as necessary.
segment.target: Get your users to visit websites, turning Enterprise Mode on or off locally, as necessary.

segment.source: To view the report results
segment.target: To view the report results

segment.source: Go to to see the report results.
segment.target: Go to to see the report results.

segment.source: If you’re already on the webpage, you’ll need to refresh the page to see the results.
segment.target: If you’re already on the webpage, you’ll need to refresh the page to see the results.

segment.source: Enterprise Mode Result report with details
segment.target: Enterprise Mode Result report with details

segment.source: Troubleshooting publishing errors
segment.target: Troubleshooting publishing errors

segment.source: If you have errors while you’re publishing your project, you should try to update your packages.
segment.target: If you have errors while you’re publishing your project, you should try to update your packages.

segment.source: To update your packages
segment.target: To update your packages

segment.source: From the Tools menu of Microsoft Visual Studio, click NuGet Package Manager, and click Manage NuGet Packages for Solution.
segment.target: From the Tools menu of Microsoft Visual Studio, click NuGet Package Manager, and click Manage NuGet Packages for Solution.

segment.source: Nuget Package Manager for package updates
segment.target: Nuget Package Manager for package updates

segment.source: Click Updates on the left side of the tool, and click the Update All button.
segment.target: Click Updates on the left side of the tool, and click the Update All button.

segment.source: You may need to do some additional package cleanup to remove older package versions.
segment.target: You may need to do some additional package cleanup to remove older package versions.
